conversation.content:
[warm] You know what's funny? I keep catching myself doing the exact same things I used to do with my scout troop. [chuckle] Like yesterday, Sarah was freaking out about that presentation, and I just... automatically went into that whole "break it down into smaller tasks" thing. [thoughtfully] The same way I'd teach kids how to, um, set up camp for the first time. [pause] And she looked at me like I'd just solved world hunger or something. [short pause]

[happy] It's weird because I never really thought those skills would, uh... translate? [confused] But now Marcus comes to me with everything, and I'm basically running the same confidence-building exercises we did before, you know, the big hikes. [animated] "You've got this, just one step at a time," all that stuff. [laugh] 

[very sincerely] And the thing is, they actually look up to me now. [shy] Which is, hmm, kind of overwhelming honestly? [empathetically] Because I remember being them, being completely lost and just needing someone to say "hey, it's okay to not know everything." [relieved] Turns out all those years of helping twelve-year-olds tie knots and navigate trails... [smiling speaking] well, apparently that's exactly what makes a good mentor. [warm] Who knew, right?
